body:
Hi, 

This issue was requested as a result of discussion on the mailing list: https://mail.python.org/pipermail/cython-devel/2016-August/004909.html

C++11 and later allows the use of && as a "universal reference" syntax: https://isocpp.org/blog/2012/11/universal-references-in-c11-scott-meyers  

It would be nice to support this syntax in Cython:

cdef void(foo MyObject && m):
       pass

Related (perhaps?): 

Robert pointed out that a C++ function could be exposed to Cython as:

void foo(T);

and that Cython doesn't care if foo is passed T, T&, or T&&.  However, this agnosticism isn't reflected in the current wrappers for STL containers, which are verbatim copies of prototypes from the standard.  This, vector::push_back only is wrapped for const T & and there is no overload for T &&.
title: Feature request: C++ rvalue references/"&&" syntax for Cython functions
